intro: Jacksonia densiflora, commonly known as the denseflowered kōwhai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its dense, showy clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with dark green, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Jacksonia densiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local wildlife.
